result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

addressed to: Joe L Rios for hearing on 9/15/22 
 No longer in custody

ADDRESS INFO for Joe L Rios

Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:36 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joe L Rios in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Joe L Rios.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on Atty. McClure's motion to modify bail and confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed today.  Atty. McClure presents arguments and is requesting the cash bail be lowered to $500.00.  State objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the Motion to Modify Bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court inquires how the matters will be proceeding.  Atty. McClure provides an update; he is requesting a further proceedings date in November.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in November.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. McClure.
Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:49 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joe L Rios in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Joe L Rios.  Atty. McClure provides an update; he needs additional time to discuss the offer with his client and figure out where the case is headed.  Atty. McClure also notes his client has asked that bail be addresses and is not sure if that can occur today.  State is asking that a formal motion be filed and another hearing date set to address bail.  Atty. McClure requests a date this week if possible.  Court notes if the matter is set for this week Atty. McClure will need to file a formal motion to modify bail by the end of business day today, 09/12/2022.  Court will adjourn for bail hearing this week.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
